CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: If I walk in there looking like the hick I am,

CONTENT: \"なんだ? こいつ\"的な目で 見られるだろうし
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: me mirarán como un bicho raro en cuanto entre...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: they'll all look at me like I don't belong there...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I made it in last time because I was with Nijika-chan, but...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I wonder if anyone's there?

CONTENT: 誰かと一緒に入りたい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I wish I had someone to go in with.

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Cinco minutos. Esperaré cinco minutos y entraré.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Five minutes. I'll wait five minutes, then go in.

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Fifteen. I'll totally go in after fifteen.

CONTENT: 何してるんだろう?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: What's she doing?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Wait.

CONTENT: 鑑賞するの やめたげて

CONTENT: はい!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Okay!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I hereby declare the first Kessoku Band members' meeting... open!

CONTENT: それじゃあ ええっと...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Now, let's see...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Oh, wait. We barely know each other, so I dunno what to talk about!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: She just admitted it!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I brought this for just such an occasion.

CONTENT: いいねー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Nice one!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: There! What'll she roll? What'll she roll?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Dun-dun-dun-dun-dun...

CONTENT: はい どうぞ ええー?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Proceed.

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Este... Por cierto, ¿van a la misma prepa?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Um... Wait, don't you both go to the same school...

CONTENT: そう 下高
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Yeah, Shima High!

CONTENT: 2人とも家が近いから選んだ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Vamos porque está cerca de casa.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: We chose it 'cause it's close to home.

CONTENT: あっ 下北沢にお住まいで
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Oh, so you live in Shimo-Kitazawa...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Bocchi, ¿tú no ibas a la Shuka?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Huh? Bocchi-chan, don't you go to Shuka High?

CONTENT: 家 ここら辺じゃないの?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Shouldn't you live around here too?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: No, yo vivo en otra prefectura. Viajo dos horas al día.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: No, I live out-of-prefecture. Two-hour commute each way.

CONTENT: えっ なんで? 2時間
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Two hours?! Why?

CONTENT: 高校は 誰も自分の過去を　知らない所に 行きたくて...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Quería ir a una prepa donde nadie conociera mi pasado.

CONTENT: はい ガコバナ終了ー
す... すみません 高校でも基本 一人なもので　その 楽しい浮かれた お話ひとつも 提供で... できなくて

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: S-Sorry... I spend most of my time at school alone, so I don't have any f-fun stories to contribute...

CONTENT: 大丈夫 大丈夫
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Hey, it's okay!

CONTENT: リョ... リョウもね そんな友達いないし
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Ryo doesn't have many friends either.

CONTENT: うん 虹夏だけ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Yeah, just Nijika.

CONTENT: えっ?　ドクン...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Tha-thump.

CONTENT: リョウさんは私と同類なんだ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Ryo-san is just like me...

CONTENT: 休みの日は 一人で廃墟探索したり
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: En sus días libres, sale a conocer la ciudad
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: On days off, she does urban exploration

CONTENT: 古着屋さん回ったり
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: y va a tiendas de segunda mano...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: and visits second-hand clothing shops...

CONTENT: いや 違う!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: No, she's not...

CONTENT: リョウさんは \"一人でいるのが好きな人\"だ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: A Ryo le gusta estar sola.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Ryo-san likes being alone!

CONTENT: コミュ症は 一人で服屋入れないし
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Alguien con ansiedad social no entra sola a una tienda.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Someone with social anxiety could never enter a clothing shop on her own!

CONTENT: \"ぼっち\"と\"一人好き\"の間には　決して埋めることのできない 深く大きな溝が!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: ¡La distancia entre alguien aislado y solitario es demasiado grande!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The gap between the lonely and the loner is too deep and vast to ever be traversed!

CONTENT: 危うくトラップに 引っ掛かるところだった
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por poco caigo en la trampa.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I nearly fell into the trap.

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃん 会話を楽しもうよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi-chan, let's enjoy the conversation!

CONTENT: 次は 好きな音楽の話ー

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I like Japanese punk, like mellow core.

CONTENT: 私はテクノ歌謡とか
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: A mí el techno kayo y últimamente
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I like techno kayo,

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: veo las listas de Arabia Saudita... -No mientas, por favor.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: and lately I've been checking the Saudi Arabian chartsー

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: That is true. Bocchi-chan?

CONTENT: あっ その...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Oh, um...

CONTENT: 青春コンプレックスを 刺激する歌以外なら なんでも
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Me gusta cualquier canción que no active mi complejo seishun.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I like any songs that don't trigger my seishun complex.

CONTENT: ん? 青春コンプレックス?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: \"Seishun complex\"?

CONTENT: 説明しよう!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Allow me to explain!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Las canciones que activan el complejo de Hitori
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Songs that trigger Hitori's seishun complex

CONTENT: 夏とか青い海 花火 淡い恋といった　ひとりの学校生活には 無縁のワードが多用されて
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: son canciones optimistas que mencionen el verano, el mar, fuegos artificiales, amor juvenil
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: are glitter-coated upbeat songs that include words like \"summer,\" \"blue sea,\" \"fireworks,\" \"puppy love,\"

CONTENT: キラキラにコーティングされた 爽やかな歌のことである
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: y lo que no tenga que ver con su experiencia escolar.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: and other things irrelevant to her personal school experience!

CONTENT: そういう歌詞聞くと 鬱々としてくる...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Such words plunge me into a deep melancholy.

CONTENT: 逆に青春時代の鬱憤を ぼっちちゃん?　歌詞に たたきつけているバンドは　大好物だよね?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por otra parte, te encantan las bandas que hablan de la desolación de la prepa, ¿no?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: By the same token, you love bands that write about the bleakness of their high school years, right?

CONTENT: うん うん
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Oh, yeah!

CONTENT: けど 好きなバンドが 学生時代から人気者なんて知ったら
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Pero a veces descubro que la banda que me gusta era famosa en la prepa
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: But sometimes I find out a band I love was super popular in school,

CONTENT: 急に遠い存在に 思えちゃったりして　おーい おねがーい 一人の世界に入らないでー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: y de repente los veo a todos como bichos raros... ¡Vamos, vuelve a la Tierra, por favor!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: and they suddenly feel like strangers to me...

CONTENT: ロックとは 負け犬が歌うから　心に響くのであって 成功者が歌えば...　おーい!　もうロックとは言わない
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: El rock suele ser la música de los perdedores. ¿Un vencedor puede tocar rock?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Rock resonates as the music of the perpetual underdog. Is it really rock if it's sung by life's winners?

CONTENT: みんな結束してよー!　結束バンドだけに

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'm trying to establish some ties, here! Since we're named after zip ties.

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Um...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Oh, do you?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The guitarist who ran off was gonna be our singer, but...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The runaway guitarist...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: No, there's no way!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Um... Wh-What about Ryo-san?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'm so jealous. I'd like a little of that confidence for myself...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I know!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Ryo can write the music,

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: y tú la letra para así no incluir tus palabras tabú.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: and if you've got off-limits words, Bocchi-chan, you should write the lyrics!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Me?!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Well? Great idea, huh?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The nine years of lunch breaks I spent in school libraries...

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Was it all in preparation for this moment?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: So, what will you do, Nijika?

CONTENT: えい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Go!

CONTENT: 次は ノルマの話ー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Next, talk about quotas!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Just shamelessly dodged that one, eh?

CONTENT: あっ あの ノルマというのは...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Um... What are quotas?

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: El concierto de ayer era un concierto reservado.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The concert we did yesterday is called a \"booked concert.\"

CONTENT: バンド側にはライブハウス側から　集客を保証するための チケットノルマが課せられていて
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: En él, el club le da unas entradas a la banda para que venga gente.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It's where the club assigns the band a ticket quota to make sure enough people come.

CONTENT: ノルマ以上売れた分は　ライブハウスとバンド側で 分け合うんだけど...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Lo que se venda por encima de ese cupo se reparte entre el club y la banda...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Anything sold over the quota gets split between the club and the band...

CONTENT: ノルマ分 集客できない場合
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Pero si no se llena el cupo mínimo,
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: But if they can't bring in enough to meet the quota,

CONTENT: その分 自腹で 払わないといけないんだ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: la banda tiene que pagar la diferencia de su bolsillo.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: the band has to pay the rest out of pocket.

CONTENT: つまり 売れるまで めちゃくちゃお金いる
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: So until you get popular, it's a money pit.

CONTENT: ざっくり まとめた!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: That's very concise!

CONTENT: 昨日のライブは　あたしの友達が 結構 来てくれたから

CONTENT: チケット はけたんだけど...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: so we managed to meet our quota, but...

CONTENT: あの出来じゃ 2回目は来ない

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: After that performance, they likely won't be back.

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You said it!

CONTENT: リョウは友達いないから 集客 当てにできないし

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: And Ryo's got no friends, so she'll be no help...

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃんは...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi-chan, do youー

CONTENT: よっ 人間国宝!

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Anyway, since we'll need tens of thousands of yen before our next concert,

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: No.

CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: M-My mom was saving up for my wedding...

CONTENT: 死刑を求刑する!
えー それでは判決 死刑
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Okay, here comes the ruling... Death!

CONTENT: こうなるに決まってる!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: And then that!

CONTENT: ...ちゃん ぼっちちゃん
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: ...cchi-chan. Bocchi-chan.

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃん!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi-chan!

CONTENT: 今の話 聞いてなかったでしょ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You weren't listening, were you?

CONTENT: あっ ご... ごめんなさい えーと なんの話を...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: S-Sorry! Wh-What were you saying?

CONTENT: ぼっちも ここでバイトする
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You should work here with us.

CONTENT: ここで...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Here?

CONTENT: へっ? ええっ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: What?!

CONTENT: あたしもリョウもいるから 怖くないよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Conmigo y con Ryo no tienes nada que temer.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You won't have to be scared if you're with me and Ryo!

CONTENT: アットホームで 和気あいあいとした職場です
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Será un lugar perfecto para trabajar.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It's a homey and harmonious place to work.

CONTENT: ドリンクスタッフとか...　働きたくない 働きたくない!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: We can serve drinks, and clean, and see all kinds of bands!

CONTENT: ね? どうかな
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Well? What do you think?

CONTENT: 断れ 自分
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Say no, girl!

CONTENT: 断れ 断るんだー!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Say no! You have to say no!

CONTENT: 頑張りましゅ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'll dwu mwy bwest...

CONTENT: ホント? ありがとう!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Really? Thanks so much!

CONTENT: ごめんね 自分
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Sorry, girl...

CONTENT: 断る勇気があるなら コミュ症してない
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Si supiera decir que no, no tendría ansiedad social.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It wouldn't be social anxiety if we had the courage to say no.

CONTENT: それと バンドの経費は あたしが管理するね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Bueno, yo me encargaré de las finanzas.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'll manage the band's funds, then.

CONTENT: えっ? あの...　リョウさんに預けたほうが いいんじゃ...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: ¿No sería mejor que se encargara Ryo?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Um... Wouldn't it be better to have Ryo-san do that?

CONTENT: どういう意味じゃ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: What's that supposed to mean?!

CONTENT: あのね ぼっちちゃん
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Listen, Bocchi-chan.

CONTENT: リョウは こう見えて めちゃくちゃ お金遣い荒いの
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Aunque no lo aparente, a Ryo le encanta derrochar.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Believe it or not, Ryo's a very irresponsible spender.

CONTENT: お金持ちで お小遣い たくさんもらってるけど
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Viene de una familia rica y tiene una buena mesada,
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Her family's rich and she gets a huge allowance,

CONTENT: 楽器に つぎ込むから 常に金欠だよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: but she blows it all on instruments, so she's constantly broke!

CONTENT: てれ...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Blush.

CONTENT: どこが褒め言葉に聞こえた?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: ¿Crees que te lo digo como un cumplido?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: What part of that did you take as a compliment?

CONTENT: じゃ 近いうちに またライブできるように頑張ろう
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Bueno, trabajaremos mucho para poder tocar pronto.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Anyway, let's work hard so we can play live again soon!

CONTENT: そして 高校生でメジャーデビュー!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Y después debutaremos en la prepa.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Then we'll make our major debut in high school!

CONTENT: バイト 来週からね 学校終わったら うちに直行で
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Empezaremos la próxima semana. Ven después de clases.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: We start work next week! Come straight here after school!

CONTENT: ぼっち バイバイ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi. Bye-bye.

CONTENT: あっ はい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: R-Right...

CONTENT: そのバイト初日が 明日に迫っていると
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Mañana es mi primer día de trabajo...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: And that first day of work is tomorrow.

CONTENT: もう30分は浸かってるし 絶対に風邪ひいたよね?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Ya llevo media hora aquí. Me voy a resfriar, ¿no?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I've been in here for thirty minutes now. I'm bound to catch a cold, right?

CONTENT: すみません すみません バイト以外は頑張りますので
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Lo siento... Me esforzaré para no trabajar.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'm sorry... I'm sorry... I'll work hard at everything except the job.

CONTENT: お母さーん! お姉ちゃん 沈んでるー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Mom! Sis is drowning!

CONTENT: 風邪ひけ風邪ひけ風邪ひけ　風邪ひけ風邪ひけ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Catch a cold! Catch a cold! Catch a cold! Catch a cold!

CONTENT: 風邪ひけぇえぇぇぇ!!!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Catch a cold!

CONTENT: 丈夫な体が憎い
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Curse this good health of mine...

CONTENT: もう こうなったら いっそ 仮病を...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Then I'll just have to fakeー

CONTENT: あっ 虹夏ちゃん　おはよう! 今日はバイト初日だね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Nijika-chan? Morning! First day of work, right?

CONTENT: 不安だろうけど ちゃんとフォローするから　一緒に頑張ろう!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Sé que estás nerviosa, pero cuenta conmigo. ¡Ánimo!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I know you're nervous, but we'll be there for you! Let's work hard together!

CONTENT: バイトを バックレようとしている私に　こんな温かい言葉を!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: No es justo que sea tan amable mientras yo evito ir al trabajo...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: No fair being so nice while I'm trying to blow off work...

CONTENT: 自分が いかに 愚かなことをしていたか　気付きました
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Gracias a ti me di cuenta de mis errores.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You've made me realize the foolish error of my ways.

CONTENT: 気付かせてくれて　私を まっとうな人間に してくれて　本当に ありがとうございます
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Te agradezco enormemente que quieras convertirme en una mujer de provecho.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: For making an honest woman out of me, you have my boundless gratitude.

CONTENT: なんの話?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: What is she talking about?

CONTENT: 着いちゃった
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'm here.

CONTENT: ぼっち頑張れ ぼっち頑張れ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Do it, Bocchi! Do it, Bocchi!

CONTENT: ぼっち頑張れ ぼっち頑張れ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Do it, Bocchi! Do it, Bocchi!

CONTENT: チケットの販売は5時からですよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Vendemos entradas a partir de las cinco.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Tickets don't go on sale until five o'clock.

CONTENT: まだ準備中なんで
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: We're still getting ready here.

CONTENT: スタッフさん? あっ 怪しまれてる
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: She works here?! She thinks I'm up to no good...

CONTENT: 誤解を解かないと!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I've got to clear this up!

CONTENT: あっ 一旦 おちおちおち... おち... 落ち着いて ててて...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: C-C-C-C-C-Calm down...

CONTENT: そっちが落ち着け
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You're the one who needs to calm down.

CONTENT: 新しいバイトの子か
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: So you're the new part-timer?

CONTENT: なら 最初から そう言いなよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You should've just said so.

CONTENT: すすす... すみません
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: S-S-S-S-Sorry!

CONTENT: あたし ここの店長だから よろしく
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'm the manager here. Nice to meet you.

CONTENT: よ... よろしくお願いします
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: V-Very nice to meet you...

CONTENT: 店長さん ちょっと怖い 苦手なタイプ　ん?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: La gerente da miedo. No sé tratar a la gente.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The manager's scary. I can't handle people like her.

CONTENT: 虹夏ちゃん 早く来てー あれ?　っていうか　段ボールに入ってライブした ギターの子じゃん
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: ¡Ven pronto, Nijika! Oye, ¿no eres la guitarrista que tocó dentro de la caja?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Nijika-chan, come here quick! Hey, you're the guitarist who played in the box.

CONTENT: 確か... マンゴー仮面?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Wasn't it... Mango Kamen?

CONTENT: 新しい あだ名?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: A new nickname?

CONTENT: 店長さん 好き!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I like you, Manager!

CONTENT: マママ... マンゴー仮面です エヘヘヘ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I-I'm Mango Kamen!

CONTENT: そんな名前じゃないでしょ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: That is not her name!

CONTENT: お姉ちゃんも 適当な あだ名 付けないでよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: No le pongas apodos raros, hermana.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Don't go giving her weird nicknames, Sis!

CONTENT: おねっ? 虹夏ちゃんのお姉様?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Sis?! You're Nijika-chan's sister?

CONTENT: 前に説明したよ?　ほら スターリー来るときに
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Te lo conté cuando viniste por primera vez, ¿te acuerdas?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I told you before. When you first came to Starry, remember?

CONTENT: 今日 出演するライブハウスは　スターリーっていうんだけどね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: El club donde tocamos se llama Starry.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The club we're gonna play at is called Starry.

CONTENT: あたしのお姉ちゃんが そこの店長やってて
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: My big sister's the manager there.

CONTENT: っていうか 店の上のマンションに あたしら家族が住んでて...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: En realidad, mi familia vive en los pisos de arriba.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Actually, our family lives in the apartments above it.

CONTENT: ああ 心臓バクバクで聞いてなかった
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Me latía tanto el corazón que no la oí.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: My heart was pounding so loud that I didn't hear her.

CONTENT: そっ そそ... そうでした
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: R-R-R-Really?

CONTENT: そういうことなので だから そんな緊張しないでいいよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Eso significa que no tienes que ponerte nerviosa.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: That means you don't have to be so nervous.

CONTENT: ね? お姉ちゃん
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Right, Sis?

CONTENT: ここでは店長って呼べ あ...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Call me \"Manager\" here.

CONTENT: あと 仕事に私情を挟むな
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Familia y trabajo no se mezclan.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: And keep our work and private relationships separate.

CONTENT: もう 怖がらせないでよー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Don't scare her like that!

CONTENT: じゃあ まずは テーブルから片そうか
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Bueno, primero vamos a limpiar las mesas.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Okay, let's clear the tables first.

CONTENT: それ終わったら拭き掃除を...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: When that's done, we'll wipe them all down...

CONTENT: って あれ? ぼっちちゃんは?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Huh? Where's Bocchi-chan?

CONTENT: すみません 暗くて狭い所で ひと息つきたくて
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Lo siento. Necesito tiempo en un sitio oscuro y cerrado.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Sorry. I needed a breather in a dark, cramped place.

CONTENT: ひと息つくの早っ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You need a breather already?!

CONTENT: じゃあ ぼっちちゃんは こっちでドリンク覚えよっか
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Muy bien, Bocchi, ven y te enseño las bebidas.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Here, Bocchi-chan, come over and learn the drinks.

CONTENT: トニックウォーターは ここから ビールは このサーバーね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Sacas la tónica de aquí y la cerveza sale de este dispensador.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Tonic water comes out of here, and beer comes out of this dispenser.

CONTENT: カクテルは後ろの棚に... うわあー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Los cócteles están en el estante...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The cocktails are on the shelf behind...

CONTENT: えっ お... 覚えられない　早い! ちょ... まっ あうあばばば...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: ¡No voy a acordarme! ¡Qué rápido! Yo... ay, ay...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I-I'll never remember it all! Too fast! I just... mummummmmm...

CONTENT: うっ 歌にして 体に覚え込ませるしかない!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'll have to infuse the knowledge into me through song!

CONTENT: うええーっ どこから出した!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Where did that come from?!

CONTENT: カクテルはー えっ 怖い怖い　楽しそうですね　覚えようとしてくれるのは うれしいけど
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Me das miedo. -Cómo se divierten. Me alegra que te las aprendas,
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You're scaring me! I'm glad you're learning the drinks,

CONTENT: 一旦 ギター置こうか
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: pero ¿qué tal si guardas la guitarra?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: but why don't you set the guitar down?

CONTENT: あれ?　前のライブは 下手くそだと思ったけど...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Qué raro... En el concierto parecía que no sabía tocar...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Weird... She seemed kind of crappy at the concert, but...

CONTENT: 上手ですねー　ちょっと 怖くなってきちゃったからー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: She's good.

CONTENT: 虹夏は止めるのに必死で 気付いてないみたいだけど
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Nijika está intentando detenerla, pero no se da cuenta de que...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Nijika's trying so hard to stop her, I don't think she realizes it...

CONTENT: この演奏の感じ どっかで...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: But I recognize that sound from somewhere.

CONTENT: 仕事しろ アイテッ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Get to work!

CONTENT: なんで あたし?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Why me?!

CONTENT: ドリンクスタッフは　注文されたドリンク注いで 渡すだけだから
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Solo tienes que servir la bebida y dársela al cliente.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: For drink service, just pour the drinks they order and hand them over.

CONTENT: は... はい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: R-Right...

CONTENT: チケット代金と別に 500円払うともらえる...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por 500 yenes además de la entrada,
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: They can pay 500 yen on top of the ticket price

CONTENT: これがドリンクチケットね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: to get a drink ticket.
500 yen per drink?

CONTENT: そもそも なんで ワンドリンク制なんだろ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: And why a drink ticket system?

CONTENT: そんな あからさまに ボッてるみたいな顔しないで
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: No lo mires como si fuera tan raro.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Stop staring like it's totally alien to you.

CONTENT: 実はライブハウスは 一応 飲食店扱いなんだよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: A estos clubes se les considera restaurantes.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Clubs like this are actually considered restaurants.

CONTENT: よく分かんないけど
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I don't know all the details,

CONTENT: ライブできる場所ってだけで 営業許可 取るのって　すごく難しいんだって
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: pero es difícil conseguir licencia solo para conciertos.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: but apparently it's super hard to get a business license to run just a concert venue.

CONTENT: な... なるほど
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I... I see!

CONTENT: だからドリンクを提供して　あくまで飲食店として お店 開くんだって
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por eso ofrecemos bebidas y operamos como restaurante.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: So we offer drinks and operate like a restaurant.

CONTENT: って 聞いてる?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Are you listening?

CONTENT: いっ... いつの間にか ハードルの高い　飲食店バイトデビューまで 果たしていたとは!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Trabajo en un restaurante de golpe. Quién diría que subiría de nivel tan rápido.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: W-Working at a restaurant is advanced stuff! I can't believe I cleared that bar so soon!

CONTENT: 私 成長してる?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Is this... personal growth?!

CONTENT: あっ いつの間にか お客さん入ってきたねー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Hey, customers already!

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃん 今から忙しくなるよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: We're about to be busy, Bocchi-chan!

CONTENT: え?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: What?

CONTENT: えっ? いきなり接客開始?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Wait... Customer service already?!

CONTENT: なんて言えばいいの?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: What do I say?!

CONTENT: 本日は お日柄も良く ご来店いただき...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: \"Thank you for your royal parentage...\"

CONTENT: って違う! せ... せめて1回 予行練習を
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: That's not it! J-Just give me a practice run, please!

CONTENT: えっ あっ やっ ちょ... 待って 待って!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: N-No, wait! Stop it!

CONTENT: 終了しちゃった!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: She closed up!

CONTENT: すみません コーラください
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Excuse me! One cola, please!

CONTENT: はーい ぼっちちゃん コーラ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Coming! Bocchi-chan, cola!

CONTENT: あっ はい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Coming up!

CONTENT: 私 ジンジャーエール あっ はい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'll have a ginger ale. Coming up!

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃん お客さんに失礼でしょ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi-chan, show some respect for the customers!

CONTENT: こここ... 心の準備が!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: B-B-But I'm not ready!

CONTENT: ライブハウスの ダークな雰囲気が失われていく
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: El club está perdiendo su ambiente sombrío.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: We're losing the club's inherent darkness.

CONTENT: ウーロン茶とハイボールでーす
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Un té oolong y whisky con soda.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: One oolong and one highball!

CONTENT: お手洗いって...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Where's the bathroom?

CONTENT: あっ 右奥進んでもらって 左です
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Down the hall to your right, door on the left!

CONTENT: 結局 何も成長などしていなかった
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I experienced no personal growth whatsoever.

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃん 見て見て
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi-chan, look!

CONTENT: えー どうも! アレキサンディズムです
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Hey, there! We're Alexandism!

CONTENT: あのバンド 結構いいんだよねー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: They're pretty good, y'know?

CONTENT: 力抜いて大丈夫 ライブ始まったら暇になるから
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Tranquila, ya puedes relajarte. Descansaremos durante la presentación.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It's a good time to relax. Once the performances start, we'll have time to kill.
Right...

CONTENT: お疲れ　お疲れー あれ 受付は?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Buen trabajo. -Gracias. ¿Ya no vendes más entradas?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Good work. Good work! Don't you have to sell tickets?

CONTENT: 店長が代わってくれた
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Manager stepped in for me.

CONTENT: 今日のバンドは どれも人気あるし　勉強になるから見とけって
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Como las bandas de hoy son famosas, me pidió que aprendiera de ellas.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: All of today's bands are really popular, so she told me to watch and learn.

CONTENT: うちのお姉ちゃん あれなの
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: That's my sister for you.

CONTENT: ツンツン...　ツンツン ツンツン ツンツンツン... デレー みたいな?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: She's a tsun-tsun-tsun-tsun-tsun-tsun-tsun... ...dere. You know?

CONTENT: ツン多い テヘッ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Excessive tsun.

CONTENT: すす... すみません 戦力にならないどころか
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Lo siento... No fui de ayuda
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: S-S-Sorry... Not only did I fail to help you,

CONTENT: お客さんと目も合わせられなくて
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: y ni siquiera miré a los clientes.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I couldn't even make eye contact with the customers.

CONTENT: これ使う? マンゴーじゃないけど
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: ¿La quieres? Pero no es para mangos.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Want this? Sorry it's not for mangos.

CONTENT: 使わない 使わない
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: No, thank you.

CONTENT: ハアー 大丈夫!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You're doing fine!

CONTENT: 今日は初日なんだし すぐ慣れるって
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Es tu primer día. Ya te acostumbrarás.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It's your first day. You'll get used to it!

CONTENT: わ... 私みたいな ミジンコ以下に　どうして そんな優しく してくれるんですか?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: ¿Por qué son tan amables con alguien inferior que una mera pulga de agua?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Wh-Why are you so nice to a sub-water-flea like me?

CONTENT: あたしね... あっ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You know...

CONTENT: このライブハウスが好きなの
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: A mí me gusta este club.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I really like this club.

CONTENT: だから ライブハウスの スタッフさんが　お客さんと関わるのって　ここと受付くらいだし
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Aquí y recepción son los únicos sitios donde interactuamos con los clientes.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: But here and reception are the only places club staff interact with the customers,

CONTENT: いい箱だったって思ってもらいたい って気持ちが いつもあって
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por eso me esfuerzo para que los demás también lo aprecien.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: so I want to do my best to make other people like it, too.

CONTENT: すすす... すみません そんな場所でド下手な接客を...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Perdón. Metí la pata en un sitio que aprecias...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'm s-s-sorry. I w-worked so badly at a place that means so much to you...

CONTENT: いや ちが...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: No, no.

CONTENT: そうじゃなくて
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: That's not what I meant.

CONTENT: あたし ぼっちちゃんにも いい箱だったって思ってほしいんだ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Me gustaría que a ti también te gustara este club.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I meant I want you to like this club too, Bocchi-chan.

CONTENT: 楽しくバイトして 楽しくバンドしたいの
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Quiero que nos divirtamos trabajando y tocando.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I want us to have fun working, and to have fun playing.

CONTENT: 一緒に
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Together.

CONTENT: まっ いつかは　笑顔で接客できるように なってほしいのもあるけど
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por supuesto, me gustaría que algún día les sonrieras a los clientes...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: 'Course, I also hope you'll be able to speak to customers with a smile some day, too...

CONTENT: あっ ぼっちちゃん 始まるよ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It's starting, Bocchi-chan!

CONTENT: 会場が一体になって お客さんも演者も楽しそう
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Todos están unidos. Los clientes y las bandas se están divirtiendo.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The whole place is united. The customers and the performers are all enjoying themselves.

CONTENT: それに比べて 私のライブは...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por otra parte, en nuestro concierto...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Meanwhile, at my concert...

CONTENT: お客さんは 2000円も払って 見に来てるんだよね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: los clientes pagaron 2000 yenes por vernos, ¿no?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: The customers paid 2,000 yen to see that, didn't they?

CONTENT: そんな人たちに 今の私のままじゃ　次もグダグダなライブを するんだろうな
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Si sigo así, seguiremos dando conciertos con las salas vacías, ¿verdad?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: If I stay the way I am, I'm gonna give them the same listless concert next time too, aren't I?

CONTENT: 少しずつでも変わる努力をして 一緒に楽しくしたい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Quiero cambiar, aunque sea poco a poco, y disfrutar de esto con ellas.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I want to make the effort to change, even if only gradually, and enjoy it with the rest of them.

CONTENT: すみません オレンジジュース
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Excuse me! Orange juice.

CONTENT: はっ... はい! あっ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: C-Coming up...

CONTENT: 笑顔で お客さんの目を見て接客
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Mira al cliente a los ojos e interactúa.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Look the customer in the eye. Interact.

CONTENT: 笑顔で...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Smile!

CONTENT: お客さんの目を見て接客
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Look her in the eye! Interact!

CONTENT: ど... どうぞー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: H-Here you are.

CONTENT: フッ フフフッ ぼっちちゃん 目 目!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi-chan! Your eyes! Your eyes!

CONTENT: ありがとう ウフフフ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Thanks!

CONTENT: いやー ドキドキしたー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Wow, that was nerve-wracking!

CONTENT: でも すごい!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: But great job!

CONTENT: カウンターから ちゃんと顔を出して接客できたね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Mantuviste la frente en alto y hablaste con ella.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: You kept your head above the counter and talked to her!

CONTENT: あっ 頑張りました　うん!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I did my best! Yeah!

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃんのおかげで　きっと今日のライブが もっと楽しい思い出になったよ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Gracias a ti recordaré este concierto aún mejor.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Having you here will make my memories of today's concert even more fun.

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃんも 一歩前進だね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: And you've taken a step forward.

CONTENT: 一歩...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: A step...

CONTENT: 一歩
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: A step.

CONTENT: 一歩ー?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: A step?!

CONTENT: 千歩ぐらい 進んだつもりだったんだけど!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It feels like I took a thousand, though!

CONTENT: じゃあ 今日は お疲れ 気をつけて帰れよ　バイバイ あっ お疲れさまでした
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Buen trabajo. -Ve con cuidado. -Adiós. Gracias por lo de hoy.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Good work today. Take care getting home. Bye-bye. Th-Thank you for having me.

CONTENT: えっ リョウは帰んないの?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Not leaving, Ryo?

CONTENT: うん もう少ししたら帰る
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Staying a little while first.

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃん! あっ えっ はい
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi-chan! Y-Yes?!

CONTENT: またね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: See you later!

CONTENT: あっ はい! ままま... また明日
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Y-Yes, s-s-s-see you tomorrow!

CONTENT: おっ... 終わったー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: It's over!

CONTENT: なんとか1日乗り切った!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I made it through an entire day somehow!

CONTENT: バイト 意外と やっていけそうな気がする
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Este trabajo no es tan duro como pensaba.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: This work thing isn't as hard as I thought it would be!

CONTENT: あ... 明日も頑張るぞー フフッ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'll do my best again tomorrow!

CONTENT: ん?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Eh?

CONTENT: ぼっち 頑張ってたね
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Bocchi worked hard, huh?

CONTENT: そだねー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Yeah.

CONTENT: それに\"また明日\" って言ってくれたねー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: And she managed to say \"see you tomorrow!\"

CONTENT: うん
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Yeah.

CONTENT: バンド組めて よかったよねー
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Me alegra haber formado esta banda.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'm glad we formed this band.

CONTENT: そうだ ぼっちちゃんにLOINEしとこ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Por cierto. Vamos a mensajear a Bocchi.
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Oh, right! Let's send a LOINE message to Bocchi-chan.

CONTENT: \"明日も頑張ろう\"って
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: I'll say, \"Let's keep it up tomorrow!\"

CONTENT: うーん ひどい熱 パパ 氷枕 作ってきて
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Tiene mucha fiebre. Cariño, prepara un paño frío, ¿sí?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: She's got an awful fever. Dear, prepare a cold compress, would you?

CONTENT: 病院 つれてくか?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Does she need a trip to the hospital?

CONTENT: い... 今頃 熱が
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: N-Now I get the fever...

CONTENT: ぼっちちゃんも 協力してくれてることだし
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_SPANISH: Ahora que tenemos a Bocchi de nuestro lado...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Now that we've got Bocchi-chan on board...

CONTENT: あとは...
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: All that's left...

CONTENT: 新しいボーカルを見つけるだけだ!
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: is to find a new vocalist!

CONTENT: これ 誰ー?
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Who's this one for?

CONTENT: はいはーい　私 私ー! フフッ
CONTENT_TRANSLATION_ENGLISH: Me, me! It's me, it's me!
